meanings.definition: Serving to exclude or prevent others from entering or participating.
meanings.sent1: The exclusory club only allowed members to enter the secret room.
meanings.sent2: The exclusory event was limited to VIP guests only.
meanings.sent3: The exclusory party had a bouncer at the door checking invitations.
meanings.sent4: Her exclusory attitude made it difficult for new friends to join her group.
meanings.sent5: The exclusory nature of the competition made it challenging for newcomers to participate.

meanings.definition: Tending to exclude or restrict access or participation.
meanings.sent1: The exclusory policy limited the number of people who could attend the event.
meanings.sent2: The exclusory rules made it hard for everyone to join in the game.
meanings.sent3: The exclusory gate was locked, keeping unwanted visitors out.
meanings.sent4: His exclusory behavior alienated those who wanted to be included.
meanings.sent5: The exclusory nature of the exam made it tough for students to pass.
